result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 12 months with the following conditions:

miscConds.notes: *Pay restitution to C.A. in the amount of $186.00 during term of probation or civil judgment.

*Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher D Sims in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
BRANCH 45 for BRANCH 31
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.  Crime Victim Impact Statement and Restitution Worksheet, filed by State.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.


Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by C.A. and Dorothy S.
Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence; forthwith.
- No contact with C.A.
- Pay restitution to C.A. in the amount of $186.00 during term of probation or civil judgment.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
-Case SPUN to Branch 45 (Honorable Judge Havas) for Branch 31 (Honorable Judge Rifelj).   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Christopher D Sims in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. State has to notify victim.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher D Sims in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defendant has picked up this new case. State to provide global offer to resolve both cases.   All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Plea hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (10/13/2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.    
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Casiedean R.

Defendant Christopher D Sims in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Defendant does qualify for PD representation. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 10-12-2015 at 01:30pm
